items.title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei killed by missile strike on Iran, says Donald Trump
items.standfirst: US president posts on Truth Social that Iran’s supreme leader, ‘one of the most evil people in History, is dead’US-Israel war on Iran: Donald Trump says Iran’s supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is dead – latest reportsIran’s supreme leader Ali Khamenei has been killed in the opening salvo of a regime change war launched on Saturday by the US and Israel, Donald Trump has claimed. The US president announced the death of the ayatollah, who has ruled Iran as supreme leader since 1989, in a post on Truth Social. “Khamenei, one of the most evil people in History, is dead,” Trump wrote.“He was unable to avoid our Intelligence and Highly Sophisticated Tracking Systems and, working closely with Israel, there was not a thing he, or the other leaders that have been killed along with him, could do.” Trump said that the goal of the military campaign, which began on Saturday morning with a barrage of missiles and airstrikes, was regime change. “This is the single greatest chance for the Iranian people to take back their Country,” he wrote. Continue reading...
items.content: US president posts on Truth Social that Iran’s supreme leader, ‘one of the most evil people in History, is dead’US-Israel war on Iran: Donald Trump says Iran’s supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is dead – latest reportsIran’s supreme leader Ali Khamenei has been killed in the opening salvo of a regime change war launched on Saturday by the US and Israel, Donald Trump has claimed. The US president announced the death of the ayatollah, who has ruled Iran as supreme leader since 1989, in a post on Truth Social. “Khamenei, one of the most evil people in History, is dead,” Trump wrote.“He was unable to avoid our Intelligence and Highly Sophisticated Tracking Systems and, working closely with Israel, there was not a thing he, or the other leaders that have been killed along with him, could do.” Trump said that the goal of the military campaign, which began on Saturday morning with a barrage of missiles and airstrikes, was regime change. “This is the single greatest chance for the Iranian people to take back their Country,” he wrote. Continue reading...

items.title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is killed in Israeli strike, ending 36-year iron rule
items.standfirst: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.
items.content: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.(Image credit: Atta Kenare)

items.title: Trump says U.S.-Israel strikes killed Iran's leader and attacks will continue "as long as necessary"

items.content: President Trump posted on Truth Social that Iranian leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is dead. He also said that military strikes will continue in Iran for "as long as necessary."

items.title: ‘This is round two’: attacks on Iran have broad support among unsurprised Israelis
items.standfirst: Air strikes halt bitter political feuding ahead of elections as prominent Israelis call for a broad open-ended warUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesUS and Israel strikes on Iran – what we know so farAir raid sirens emptied Israel’s streets on Saturday and filled its bomb shelters, as the country braced for waves of Iranian attacks.But individual fear and resignation did not temper broad political and popular support for the country’s second regional war in less than a year. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump on reports of Ayatollah's death: 'We feel that is a correct story'
items.standfirst: In a conversation with Meet the Press moderator Kristen Welker, President Trump said he believed reports on the death of Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in strikes against the country are "a correct story."

items.title: Iran's supreme leader's presumed death is "day of celebration," Masih Alinejad says
items.standfirst: Iranian-American activist and CBS News contributor Masih Alinejad said Iranians are experiencing a range of emotions, including hope and concern, after U.S. and Israel launched a major operation against Iran. She added Iranians are concerned the attack won't lead to regime change, which she says is a "huge risk for people inside Iran." She also reacted to New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's statement on the military operation and reports that Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is presumed dead after the strikes.
items.content: Iranian-American activist and CBS News contributor Masih Alinejad said Iranians are experiencing a range of emotions, including hope and concern, after U.S. and Israel launched a major operation against Iran. She added Iranians are concerned the attack won't lead to regime change, which she says is a "huge risk for people inside Iran." She also reacted to New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's statement on the military operation and reports that Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is presumed dead after the strikes.

items.title: A visual guide to US-Israeli strikes on Iran – and Tehran’s response
items.standfirst: Missiles and bombs landed across Iran, hitting political and security targets in Tehran, including supreme leader’s residenceUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesUS and Israel strikes on Iran – what we know so farThe US and Israel have announced the beginning of an unprecedented joint operation against Iran, beginning with a wide-ranging bombing campaign aimed at regime change.Israeli jets and US missiles struck hundreds of targets across Iran, sending residents fleeing in panic from major urban centres. Among the targets were Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khameini, and Iran’s president, Masoud Pezeshkian, as well as weapons facilities across the country. Continue reading...

items.title: Major US-Israeli attacks on Iran: How did we get here ?
items.standfirst: The U.S. and Israel attacked Iran on Saturday in what President Donald Trump said was a massive operation to destroy the country’s military capabilities and eliminate the threat of it creating a nuclear weapon. Iran’s Foreign Ministry said it would defend its homeland and its Revolutionary Guard said it launched counterattacks, firing drones and missiles at Israel and strikes aimed at U.S. military installations in Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.
items.content: The U.S. and Israel attacked Iran on Saturday in what President Donald Trump said was a massive operation to destroy the country’s military capabilities and eliminate the threat of it creating a nuclear weapon. Iran’s Foreign Ministry said it would defend its homeland and its Revolutionary Guard said it launched counterattacks, firing drones and missiles at Israel and strikes aimed at U.S. military installations in Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.

items.title: RAF jets flying defensive missions after US-Israeli attack on Iran, Starmer says
items.standfirst: PM says British planes ‘in the sky today’ to protect allies in Middle East from retaliatory strikes by TehranUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesUS and Israel strikes on Iran: what we know so farKeir Starmer has said RAF fighter jets are flying “in the sky today” to defend allies in the Middle East against Iranian retaliation after the US and Israel launched a bombing campaign aimed at regime change in Tehran.The UK did not participate in the first waves of strikes against Iran on Saturday morning and has no immediate intention of doing so, but fighter jets were running defensive operations from Qatar and Cyprus to shoot down any incoming drones and missiles. Continue reading...

items.title: US and Israel attack Iran as Trump says US begins 'major combat operations'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Washington had begun "major combat operations" in Iran after Israel and the United States launched a joint attack on the Islamic Republic Saturday. In retaliation, Iran attacked Israel as well as several US military bases across the region, notably in Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Washington had begun "major combat operations" in Iran after Israel and the United States launched a joint attack on the Islamic Republic Saturday. In retaliation, Iran attacked Israel as well as several US military bases across the region, notably in Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates.

items.title: What to know about the U.S. and Israeli attacks on Iran
items.standfirst: The U.S. and Israel launched military strikes in Iran, targeting Khamenei and the Iranian president. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said Saturday morning.
items.content: The U.S. and Israel launched military strikes in Iran, targeting Khamenei and the Iranian president. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said Saturday morning. (Image credit: AP)

items.title: Why did the US and Israel strike Iran? #politics
items.standfirst: What happened and the immediate rationale U.S. and Israeli forces carried out coordinated strikes against Iranian targets after the administration concluded that recent Iranian activity posed an unacceptable risk to regional partners and U.S. interests. items.title: Photos: Israelis seek shelter as Iran launches retaliatory strikes

items.content: Sirens rang out across major cities across Israel after the strikes on Iran and civilians were pictured seeking shelter wherever they could find it.

items.title: Trump's Iran attack is a huge gamble - and he cannot control the consequences

clusters.title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
clusters.neutral_headline: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
bullet_summary: Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas
A military plane has crashed on to ‌a busy road in the ​city of El Alto, near Bolivia's capital La Paz, killing at least 15 people and injuring at least 30 others, officials have said

items.title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.
items.content: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

items.title: At least 20 killed as cash-laden military cargo plane crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...
items.content: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...

items.title: Bolivia Plane Carrying Bank Cash Crashes, Killing at Least 10
items.standfirst: A Bolivian military aircraft transporting cash for the central bank crashed near El Alto International Airport in the western part of the country, leaving more than 10 people dead and an unspecified number injured.
items.content: A Bolivian military aircraft transporting cash for the central bank crashed near El Alto International Airport in the western part of the country, leaving more than 10 people dead and an unspecified number injured.

items.content: Pakistan declared “open war” on Afghanistan on Friday after the two South Asian neighbors traded overnight attacks, with both sides claiming to inflict heavy damage in a sharp escalation of their long-running dispute.

items.title: Burnham would probably have won by-election, Labour deputy leader says
items.standfirst: Lucy Powell tells the BBC that Labour needs to make more use of the Greater Manchester mayor.
items.content: Lucy Powell tells the BBC that Labour needs to make more use of the Greater Manchester mayor.

items.title: Burnham would ‘probably’ have won byelection, says Labour deputy leader
items.standfirst: Lucy Powell calls for party to make more use of Greater Manchester mayor after Gorton and Denton defeatAndy Burnham would have won the Gorton and Denton byelection, Labour’s deputy leader said as she called for the party to make more use of the Greater Manchester mayor.Overturning a 13,000 Labour majority from the general election, Hannah Spencer, a local plumber and Green councillor, became the party’s fifth MP on Friday in an area that had returned Labour MPs for nearly a century. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Russia may interfere in Danish election, exploiting chaos sown by US, spies warn
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia may interfere in Danish election, exploiting chaos sown by US, spies warn
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Bloomberg Technology

items.title: Russia may interfere in Danish election, exploiting chaos sown by US, spies warn
items.standfirst: US threats to seize Greenland have created ‘new international fault lines’ that can be used to spread disinformation, Danish intelligence agencies sayDenmark’s intelligence services have warned that a foreign power may try to sway the general election on 24 March, saying the main threat was from Russia over support for Ukraine but also citing the chaos caused by US efforts to seize Greenland.The PET police intelligence service and FE military intelligence said in a joint statement the election campaign could be marked by disinformation and cyberattacks “to sow division, influence the public debate or to target candidates, parties or specific political programmes”. Continue reading...
items.content: US threats to seize Greenland have created ‘new international fault lines’ that can be used to spread disinformation, Danish intelligence agencies sayDenmark’s intelligence services have warned that a foreign power may try to sway the general election on 24 March, saying the main threat was from Russia over support for Ukraine but also citing the chaos caused by US efforts to seize Greenland.The PET police intelligence service and FE military intelligence said in a joint statement the election campaign could be marked by disinformation and cyberattacks “to sow division, influence the public debate or to target candidates, parties or specific political programmes”. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark Warns of Interference from Russia, US in March Election
items.standfirst: Denmark’s intelligence services warned that foreign powers may seek to interfere in the country’s March 24 general election, singling out Russia as the primary threat but also flagging the US and China as potential sources of influence.
items.content: Denmark’s intelligence services warned that foreign powers may seek to interfere in the country’s March 24 general election, singling out Russia as the primary threat but also flagging the US and China as potential sources of influence.
